title: Apeirogon
summary: In geometry, an apeirogon (from Ancient Greek  .mw-parser-output .noitalic{font-style:normal}ἄπειρος apeiros 'infinite, boundless', and  γωνία gonia 'angle') or infinite polygon is a polygon with an infinite number of sides. Apeirogons are the two-dimensional case of infinite polytopes. In some literature, the term "apeirogon" may refer only to the regular apeirogon, with an infinite dihedral group of symmetries.[1]
